Job TypeFull-timeDescriptionPaylocity is a cloud-based software company that creates customized HR solutions for small to mid-sized organizations. Our workplace enhances communication and enables employees to connect, collaborate, and create from anywhere. Our award-winning culture ensures everyone has a voice and feels truly welcome. Join Paylocity as we shape the future of technology and the workplace!We give our employees what they need to succeed, including great benefits and perks! We offer medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and a 401(k) match, as well as perks that support you, your family, and your finances. And if it’s career development you desire, we provide that, too! At Paylocity, people matter most and have always been at the heart of our business.When you feel like you belong, work is no longer work – it's personal. At Paylocity, we believe better employees lead to better companies. Workplaces and cultures that care will build the future, and at Paylocity, we’re doing just that. Join us as we change the future and transform your career!Position OverviewThe Data Privacy Manager contributes to the success of Paylocity’s privacy program by identifying, assessing, and developing solutions to reduce privacy risks as part of a comprehensive and growing privacy program. Reporting to the Head of Data Privacy, this role will work closely with stakeholders from across the organization to champion consistent and effective data privacy practices, while minimizing privacy risk and ensuring the protection of personal information.Location: RemoteReports To: Head of Data PrivacyResponsibilitiesWork closely with the Head of Data Privacy to advance the privacy strategy and execute the privacy roadmapMonitor and evaluate evolving laws, rules, regulations, and provide guidance to the business on the implementation of related requirements to help maintain compliance and strategic alignmentManage day-to-day activities related to contracts, benefits administration and international operationsOwn and manage relevant strategic privacy compliance projectsParticipate in the maintenance and enhancement of privacy program compliance requirementsSupport privacy compliance reviews and oversee remediation activities across the organizationProvide subject matter expertise on a variety of privacy-related programs, initiatives, and workflows Mentor and support privacy team members and privacy championsCommunicate project progress, escalations, and issues to key stakeholdersRequirementsAt least 7 years of experience in the field of privacy, legal or consulting with focus on privacy program managementExtensive knowledge of US and global privacy laws and regulations, including GDPR, CPRA, GLBA and HIPAAExperience with different privacy frameworks, including GAPP and NISTExperience working with legal and procurement teams to negotiate and execute service agreementsAbility to translate privacy requirements into practical solutions and outcomesAt least 5 years of people managementFamiliarity with privacy management technologyEducation and CertificationBachelor’s or Master’s degree in business, law, cybersecurity, information systems, engineering, data science or related field of studyJD is a plusOne or more privacy certification required (CIPP/E, CIPP/US, CIPT or CIPM)Soft SkillsStrong communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with cross functional teams and build consensus among stakeholdersAbility to exercise good judgment and balance risks in ambiguous and complex situations Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence without authorityExcellent work ethics and flexibilityGrowth mindset – every new challenge is an opportunity to learn and grow Ability to quickly spot issues and appropriately prioritize risk and outcomes Extremely organized with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and drive projects to successful completionWorks well in collaborative team environment Passionate about privacy and technology Must be a strong team player (no job is too small or too large) and willing to take on additional responsibilitiesPaylocity is an equal opportunity employer.Paylocity is committed to the full inclusion of all individuals. We comply with federal and state disability laws and make reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. To request reasonable accommodation in the job application or interview process, please contact accessibility@paylocity.com.This role can be performed from any office in the US. The pay range for this position is $140,000 - $160,000yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This position is eligible for an annual bonus and restricted stock unit grant based on individual performance in addition to a full range of benefits outlined here. This information is provided per the relevant state and local pay transparency laws for the location in which this position will be performed. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via www.paylocity.com/careers.
